Name: Seated statue of Hen-Ka
Description: Hen-Ka is sitting on a block throne, which is inscribed on the front. The broad body, still bearing traces of paint, does not have many details. Hen-Ka is wearing the gala kilt and a short echelon-curl wig. His hands are resting on his thighs, the left flat, the right clenched in a fist. The elaborate list of titles mentions high positions in the administration to do with legal matters.
